info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 03 at 10:58PM CDT by NWS Bismarck
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF NORTHEASTERN SIOUX, EASTERN HETTINGER, SOUTH CENTRAL BURLEIGH, SOUTHEASTERN MORTON, GRANT AND EMMONS COUNTIES THROUGH 1130 PM CDT/1030 PM MDT/... At 1056 PM CDT, or 956 PM MDT, strong thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 4 miles northwest of New Leipzig to Solen to 6 miles northeast of Strasburg. Movement was north at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts to 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Linton, Elgin, Fort Yates, Strasburg, Carson, Hazelton, Flasher, New Leipzig, Solen, Hague, Westfield, Cannon Ball, Braddock, Heart Butte Dam, St. Anthony, Prairie Knights Resort, Shields, Lark, Raleigh and Leith. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 300 AM CDT/200 AM MDT/ for south central, southeastern and southwestern North Dakota.
